Maria Heloísa Corrêa Rodrigues Pedro

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6005256150741608
  • Última atualização do currículo em 19/10/2016

Possui graduação em Odontologia pela Universidade do Sagrado Coração (1996), mestrado em Odontologia Saúde Coletiva (2003) pela Universidade de São Paulo, Faculdade de Odontologia de Bauru (FOB) e doutorado em Odontologia (Biologia Oral) pela Universidade de São Paulo - FOB (2007). Entre 2007 a 2014 atuou como professora de Radiologia Odontológica no Centro Universitário Central Paulista (UNICEP) no curso Superior de Tecnologia em Radiologia. Atualmente trabalha no Instituto São Lucas de Radiologia Odontológica e Documentação. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2004 - 2007
1.Fingernail and urine fluoride:comparison between children reciving naturalli fluoridated water, articially water, fluoridated salt and fluoridated milk
Descrição: This study will compare fingernails and urine F concentations in pre-school children receiving systemic Ffrom different sources: artificially fluoridated water (Bauru, State of São Paulo, Brazil, 0.6-0.8 ppm F), naturally fluoridated water (Catolé do Tocha, State of Paraíba, Brazil, 0.7 ppm F0, fluoridated salt (Lima, Peru, 200 ppm F) and fluoridated milk (Peru, 250 ml of milk contining 0.25 mgF/day). A non-fluoridated Brazilia community (Pirajuí, State of São Paulo) will be included as a negative control. Twenty 4-6-year-old children in each community will take part in the study, after approval by the IRB of Bauru Dental School and also the National Research Council (Brazil). All the children will be long-life residents of the respective communities and will have consume only water from the public supply. Only children that have a good oral health, are not using medicines and have not gastrointestinal, bone or renal problems are eligible to participate. Parents will sign and informed consent...
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (2) / Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Maria Heloísa Corrêa Rodrigues Pedro - Integrante / Marília Afonso Rabelo Buzalaf - Coordenador / Ana Arana - Integrante / Fábio Correia Sampaio - Integrante / Rita Sarmiento Vilena - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Borrow Milk Foundation - Auxílio financeiro.
2001 - 2003
1.Unha como biomarcador de exposição subcrônica do dentifrício fluoretado em crianças de 2-3 anos.
Descrição: This work evaluated the use of fingermail and toenails as biomarkers of subchronic expousure to fluoride (F) fron fluoride dentifrice (FD) in 2-to 3- year old children used a placebo dentifrice (without F) for 28 days, FD (1,57 o ppm Fas monoflurophosphate) for the following 28 days, and then placebo dentifrice for an additional 28 days, then returned to their usual dentifrices. Fingernails and toenails werwclipped every 2 weeka, during the experimental period and for an additional 22 weeks. Nails F was analysed by electrode dollowing hexamethyldisiloxane-facilated diffusion. There were no signifcant differences between fingernails and toenails F Concentration. Mean peak F concentration occurred 15 weeks after starting the use of FD. Results suggest That Fingernails and toenails mau be suitable biomarkers of subchronic expoure to F fron FD in small children..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Maria Heloísa Corrêa Rodrigues Pedro - Integrante / Marília Afonso Rabelo Buzalaf - Coordenador.
